DOC.brief_summary: To compare the efficacy and safety of two non-preserved artificial tears, (carboxymethylcellulose 0.5%, + glycerin 0.9% vs. sodium hyaluronate 0.18%) eye drops for the treatment of the signs and symptoms of dry eye disease.
DOC.brief_title: Study to Compare the Efficacy and Safety of Two Non-Preserved Artificial Tears for the Treatment of Dry Eye Signs and Symptoms
DOC.criteria: Current use of an artificial tear product at least 2 times per day (e.g. for relief of dry eye symptoms of dryness). Be likely to complete the entire course of study and to comply with appropriate instructions Have undergone refractive surgery (e.g., cataract surgery, PRK, LASIK, or any surgery involving a limbal or corneal incision) within the last 12 months. Have uncontrolled systemic disease Are currently using, or have used within 14 days of study enrollment, any ocular medications other than artificial tears Have anticipated contact lens wear during the study Have an active ocular infection
